intro: Seseli libanotis var. minor, commonly known as the Lesser Lebanon Seseli, is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils, often found in mountainous regions of the Mediterranean. It has pinnately divided leaves that are aromatic and often have a mild licorice-like scent. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
